commit_message:
Wait a moment for mdev to come up

The previous reload (multipath -r) in _rescan_multipath can
cause /dev/mapper/<wwid> to be deleted and re-created. And
right in between that, os.stat(mdev) fails to find the file.

Change-Id: Ie780f77729cdf4aa89db66f1d9a818c02b8d0a34
Partial-Bug: #1591310

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-04 13:00:48.000000000', 'files': ['tools/test-setup.sh'], 'message': 'Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: I7827b3e9ea341108e139f69bf342ec7a7f297a49
Needed-By: Ie775b9ebb989f2625faa38240a4ada59f05fab5c

'}]
commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Change-Id: I7827b3e9ea341108e139f69bf342ec7a7f297a49
Needed-By: Ie775b9ebb989f2625faa38240a4ada59f05fab5c
(cherry picked from commit 15f735a8c8960042a7531def7e4aed83828f1dae)

Cinder now will raise 500 error if users list resources with
"--sort_key=name" and "--marker=resource_id"(the marker resource's

Most of the code is copied from glance[1]

Change-Id: Ia1052be567de63083cc6c28a2e5b38a7b8470615

commit_message:
Don't use None value for sql query.

Cinder now will raise 500 error if users list resources with
"--sort_key=name" and "--marker=resource_id"(the marker resource's
name should be None here).

This patch add sql "case" sentence to avoid use None value direcetly.

Most of the code is copied from glance[1]

Oslo.db now have the same paginate_query function and the problem
has been solved in a recent patch[2] as well. But it still has some
bugs: with the oslo.db' code,  when the maker resource is not None,
the return value doesn't contain resouces which names are None.

So it's not the time to use oslo.db here. Just fix this bug in Cinder
first.

[1]:
I2187c41a3fab8b5813ba3a5e0f3249ee5dd981ed
Ib3b5f3f57be3683ba274f0122e6314978a79e75f

[2]:
Iea2cd0bb2556b0b15a0baaa76ef522a3097f9928

Co-authored-by: Stuart McLaren<stuart.mclaren@hpe.com>
Closes-bug: #1657331
Change-Id: Ia1052be567de63083cc6c28a2e5b38a7b8470615

commit_message:
First pass at imagecache

Imagecache checks for LV with names like i_* and
compares that list to a list of currently used images. It will
then remove all images not currently being used.

Localdisk will check if there is a cached image available, if there
is, use it. Otherwise create a cached image to use. Then use it.

Change-Id: Ibc60d633153ca0cfa2b1c8c3e0cbdb80a1546409
Implements: bp image-cache-powervm

commit_message:
Add warning to requirements for psutil change

A recent change to psutil changed how used memory is calculated.
This will make some memory metrics inaccurate if psutil is updated.
This adds a warning to the requirements file for anyone updating
the version of psutil used.

Change-Id: I4982266b2c328b095fe252a855619a3b94764156

commit_message:
Avoiding duplication of service available group in tempest plugin

Avoiding duplication of service available group in tempest plugin.
This registering of service available group is already being done as part of upstream tempest configuration.
Since we are using the same config object from upstream,it can be reused instead of registering it again.

Change-Id: I2f1e5ca85eedcfc61b23bb6d8f91c69c577b1db0
closes-Bug: #1662469

commit_message:
Update networking-calico docs

Most networking-calico docs are now part of the wider Calico project
documentation at http://docs.projectcalico.org/master, so this commit removes
the equivalent content that was previously here.

In addition, the remaining doc is updated to
- link correctly to http://docs.projectcalico.org/master
- reflect that networking-calico is no longer part of the Neutron stadium.

Change-Id: I6c2aee2d84a4cd2fb69c864f84d99227d9318ffb

commit_message:
Use only_contrib option for nova_client calls

Use the only_contrib option that was added by
I030f4c55c2795c7f7973f5f12e54b9819c4a5578 to speed up nova_client calls
and skip the search for nova_client extensions to reduce
/var/log/audit noise.

Change-Id: Ic97b342a3633ffdf05b02ddd81baad88e1605a75
Closes-Bug: #1509500

commit_message:
This feature is supporting for workers config in ironic-api.

Currently it's not working in ironic-api, in spite of
setting openstack_service_workers config in globals.yml.

Because it's not implement about workers in ironic.

Closes-Bug: #1661173

Change-Id: I89de95fe03813ae44bcdbf9aac22b7337ffe4968
Signed-off-by: jangpro2 <jangseon.ryu@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit d4c8e2d01fb596e871d290c5e405dba7c73a7eff)

commit_message:
This feature is supporting for workers config in ironic-api.

Currently it's not working in ironic-api, in spite of
setting openstack_service_workers config in globals.yml.

Because it's not implement about workers in ironic.

Closes-Bug: #1661173

Change-Id: I89de95fe03813ae44bcdbf9aac22b7337ffe4968
Signed-off-by: jangpro2 <jangseon.ryu@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit d4c8e2d01fb596e871d290c5e405dba7c73a7eff)

subject: Configure pools.yaml inside Designate role
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-02-02 23:04:41.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/designate-pools-yaml-support-d693dc2471642167.yaml', 'tasks/designate_post_install.yml', 'tests/pools.yaml.sample', 'tasks/designate_db_setup.yml', 'tests/test-install-designate.yml', 'tests/pools.yaml.sample.centos', 'defaults/main.yml', 'tests/os_designate-overrides.yml', 'templates/designate.conf.j2'], 'message': "Configure pools.yaml inside Designate role

This adds the ability for a user to configure the Designate
pools.yaml file inside of the role by specifying an attribute.

Because the data required is yaml, it's a nice mapping to specify
the yaml attribute and have it dumped directly to the pools.yaml
file.

This allows users to use attributes from other plays (perhaps setting
up some complex DNS infrastructure in their cloud) and insert them
into Designate without having to write their own template or supply
their own file.

This also invokes the `designate-manage` command to load the pools.yaml
file into the Designate database, and simplifies the tests that
do the pools.yaml needful.

Change-Id: I11a849898bf33aa6b8aa6605296ac7fd733d7c01
"}]
commit_message:
Configure pools.yaml inside Designate role

This adds the ability for a user to configure the Designate
pools.yaml file inside of the role by specifying an attribute.

Because the data required is yaml, it's a nice mapping to specify
the yaml attribute and have it dumped directly to the pools.yaml
file.

This allows users to use attributes from other plays (perhaps setting
up some complex DNS infrastructure in their cloud) and insert them
into Designate without having to write their own template or supply
their own file.

This also invokes the `designate-manage` command to load the pools.yaml
file into the Designate database, and simplifies the tests that
do the pools.yaml needful.

Change-Id: I11a849898bf33aa6b8aa6605296ac7fd733d7c01

commit_message:
Fix for installing repo-server with limit

This fix is required if we rebuild a repo container and install
openstack-ansible only to that host. Without this fix we need to run
openstack-service against all nodes.

Closes-Bug: 1659962
Change-Id: I0e50e2b1861fa7944aebfefcbcbee58207426a00

commit_message:
re-create ocata branch for mox3

The mox3 stable/ocata branch was created, and then a new release was
posted from master instead of the branch. Recreate the branch at the new
version.

Change-Id: Ie3d4d8875c678f9820bd06f99b99d28cca0c8a57
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Move scenario variables under vars
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-06 21:18:23.000000000', 'files': ['tests/bootstrap-aio.yml'], 'message': 'Move scenario variables under vars

This is so variables can be overridden in playbooks
that include bootstrap-aio.yml. Otherwise, the variables
specified at time of the role invocation will always take
precedence.

Change-Id: I6f17ec57a2c32fb39be7d90c11fb455ac20f7f9e
Backport-Of: Ie2df5f4b18795edbc4abec1c348057106537f857
'}]
commit_message:
Move scenario variables under vars

This is so variables can be overridden in playbooks
that include bootstrap-aio.yml. Otherwise, the variables
specified at time of the role invocation will always take
precedence.

Change-Id: I6f17ec57a2c32fb39be7d90c11fb455ac20f7f9e
Backport-Of: Ie2df5f4b18795edbc4abec1c348057106537f857

commit_message:
Change version from 0.4.0 to 0.5.0

0.4.0 has been released, and we are really on 0.5.0 development
now.  This should change after each milestone is reached, not prior
to each milestone to prevent scrambling at the end of a milestone.

Change-Id: I13615215fc5f9daeb3c28566c3a7bf1649d93228

commit_message:
Fix different repo issue for documentation

The kolla has been seperated to two different repo kolla and kolla-ansible,
the documentation in kolla-kubernetes needs to be update.

Change-Id: I3a6fc7d66ec261d33f842cfc437642d27c4c061e

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-06 17:03:26.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic'], 'message': '[devstack] Allow using "ipmi" hardware type

Currently only the default interfaces are supported.

Also fail devstack if the deploy driver is neither in enabled_drivers
not in enabled_hardware_types, as we no longer can easily detect which
list to append it to automagically.

Change-Id: I055497963f05833bf065ab396fff9b628357fc08
Partial-Bug: #1524745

commit_message:
[devstack] Allow using "ipmi" hardware type

Currently only the default interfaces are supported.

Also fail devstack if the deploy driver is neither in enabled_drivers
not in enabled_hardware_types, as we no longer can easily detect which
list to append it to automagically.

Change-Id: I055497963f05833bf065ab396fff9b628357fc08
Partial-Bug: #1524745

commit_message:
Move scenario variables under vars

This is so variables can be overridden in playbooks
that include bootstrap-aio.yml. Otherwise, the variables
specified at time of the role invocation will always take
precedence.

Backport-Of: Ie2df5f4b18795edbc4abec1c348057106537f857

commit_message:
This feature is supporting for collecting log from IPA.

Ironic supports collecting log from IPA for debugging,
But it's not defined in kolla.

This is default settings about collecting log from IPA.

Closes-Bug: #1661468

Change-Id: Iccb47a70b12effb5a704435f334faee29538f9d2
Signed-off-by: jangpro2 <jangseon.ryu@gmail.com>

commit_message:
K8S: Allows to specify admission control plugins to enable

If nothing is specified a set of recommended default plugins is used,
which includes the ServiceAccount one.

Change-Id: I1383aae09ba68f8e83b07e3eaae40ab071f7be94
Closes-Bug: #1646489

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-07 12:48:59.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometerclient/apiclient/exceptions.py', 'ceilometerclient/common/utils.py', 'ceilometerclient/apiclient/base.py', 'ceilometerclient/apiclient/auth.py', 'ceilometerclient/tests/unit/v2/test_alarms.py', 'ceilometerclient/v2/shell.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I9a4545d5c6a022c7c525142bbfa3294a89a7e8a7
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can
use dict.items instead, as it will return
iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys
will more readable. 2.In py2, the performance
about list should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

subject: Fix test_replicator assertion
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-06 16:19:56.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_replicator.py'], 'message': 'Fix test_replicator assertion

Because random.randint includeds both endpoints so that
random.randint(0, 9) which is assigned in replicatore
should be [0-9]. Hence, the assertion for replication_cycle should be
*less or equal to* 9. And the replication_cycle should be mod of 10.

Change-Id: I81da375a4864256e8f3b473d4399402f83fc6aeb
'}]
commit_message:
Fix test_replicator assertion

Because random.randint includeds both endpoints so that
random.randint(0, 9) which is assigned in replicatore
should be [0-9]. Hence, the assertion for replication_cycle should be
*less or equal to* 9. And the replication_cycle should be mod of 10.

Change-Id: I81da375a4864256e8f3b473d4399402f83fc6aeb

commit_message:
Using yaml.safe_load instead of yaml.load

It is not safe to call yaml.load with any data received from
an untrusted source, we'd better use yaml.safe_load

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I175ab89d408b38d5370621c0fd2cf78685e951f7

subject: Tenant/Global SNAT application (phase 2) patch #2
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-07 10:33:21.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/conf/df_snat.py', 'dragonflow/common/constants.py', 'dragonflow/controller/bridge_connector_app.py', 'dragonflow/controller/common/constants.py', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'dragonflow/conf/df_connector.py', 'dragonflow/conf/df_common_params.py', 'dragonflow/controller/snat_app.py', 'dragonflow/controller/base_snat_app.py', 'dragonflow/tests/unit/test_tenant_snat_app.py', 'dragonflow/conf/__init__.py', 'dragonflow/tests/unit/test_app_base.py', 'dragonflow/tests/unit/test_snat_app.py', 'dragonflow/controller/tenant_snat_app.py', 'dragonflow/neutron/ml2/mech_driver.py'], 'message': 'Tenant/Global SNAT application (phase 2) patch #2

This patch combines 2 sNAT modes as described in spec
 - chassis based sNAT
 - tenant chassis based sNAT (requires mech_driver support)

Bridge creation code moved to separate TEMPORARY application
 - bridge_connector

Chassis sNAT mode has 2 configuration parameters
 - external_host_ip
 - external_host_mac
Tenant sNAT mode has extra mech_driver parameter to allocate provider IPs
 - enable_addr_alloc_for_snat

Update: changed application name from SNATApp to ChassisSNATApp
        provider_networks commit would deprecate bridge_connector

Implements: blueprint snat-distribution
Change-Id: I2e8498462f7595823cde67afd4b506dfa8cc2f42
'}]
commit_message:
Tenant/Global SNAT application (phase 2) patch #2

This patch combines 2 sNAT modes as described in spec
 - chassis based sNAT
 - tenant chassis based sNAT (requires mech_driver support)

Bridge creation code moved to separate TEMPORARY application
 - bridge_connector

Chassis sNAT mode has 2 configuration parameters
 - external_host_ip
 - external_host_mac
Tenant sNAT mode has extra mech_driver parameter to allocate provider IPs
 - enable_addr_alloc_for_snat

Update: changed application name from SNATApp to ChassisSNATApp
        provider_networks commit would deprecate bridge_connector

Implements: blueprint snat-distribution
Change-Id: I2e8498462f7595823cde67afd4b506dfa8cc2f42

subject: Add optional exception for check_rules
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-18 15:09:50.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_policy/policy.py', 'oslo_policy/tests/test_policy.py'], 'message': 'Add optional exception for check_rules

Rather than checking for a True/False return from check_rules some
consumers may want it to raise an exception instead. This adds a
parameter, defaulting to False, which will cause check_rules to raise an
exception if set to True and a rule violation is found.

Co-Authored-By: ChangBo Guo(gcb) <eric.guo@easystack.cn>
Change-Id: Ie69bbc7081e84d019b85b62a45589ed331cc1f15
'}]
commit_message:
Add optional exception for check_rules

Rather than checking for a True/False return from check_rules some
consumers may want it to raise an exception instead. This adds a
parameter, defaulting to False, which will cause check_rules to raise an
exception if set to True and a rule violation is found.

Co-Authored-By: ChangBo Guo(gcb) <eric.guo@easystack.cn>
Change-Id: Ie69bbc7081e84d019b85b62a45589ed331cc1f15

subject: refactors cold migration / resize
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2017-02-03 13:55:21.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/nova/pathutils.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_migrationops.py', 'hyperv/nova/migrationops.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/cluster/test_driver.py', 'hyperv/tests/unit/test_pathutils.py', 'hyperv/nova/cluster/driver.py'], 'message': 'refactors cold migration / resize

Simplifies the cold resize / migration process by making the
destination node pull the VM files from the source instead of
vice-versa. Doing so, the logic is simplified greatly, the
destination node only has to copy the files, regardless if it
is on shared storage or not.

Solves the migration issue when the compute nodes have different
instances_path config option set, as the destination node will
copy the files to its configured instances_path folder.

Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Change-Id: Ia44850675e8cb8eb21017e1c4321802574dfe6a0
'}]
commit_message:
refactors cold migration / resize

Simplifies the cold resize / migration process by making the
destination node pull the VM files from the source instead of
vice-versa. Doing so, the logic is simplified greatly, the
destination node only has to copy the files, regardless if it
is on shared storage or not.

Solves the migration issue when the compute nodes have different
instances_path config option set, as the destination node will
copy the files to its configured instances_path folder.

Co-Authored-By: Claudiu Belu <cbelu@cloudbasesolutions.com>

Change-Id: Ia44850675e8cb8eb21017e1c4321802574dfe6a0

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-06 02:02:33.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/db/test_api.py', 'neutron/db/api.py'], 'message': "Add DBError to _is_nested_instance

Add support for oslo.db's DBError to is_nested_instance
so we can check for IntegrityErrors in DBErrors easily
that come back from oslo.db.

This will enable the patch that depends on this to detect
port creation/network delete races very easily and retry
them.

Change-Id: I617f2549caced6547d478caba968710ad8f913b3
"}]
commit_message:
Add DBError to _is_nested_instance

Add support for oslo.db's DBError to is_nested_instance
so we can check for IntegrityErrors in DBErrors easily
that come back from oslo.db.

This will enable the patch that depends on this to detect
port creation/network delete races very easily and retry
them.

Change-Id: I617f2549caced6547d478caba968710ad8f913b3

subject: swift-plugin: lazy load of swift connection
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-07 09:57:33.000000000', 'files': ['karbor/services/protection/bank_plugins/swift_bank_plugin.py'], 'message': "swift-plugin: lazy load of swift connection

Swift bank plugin's ctor is trying to create a swift connection. If
keystone or swift are down, loading of the provider fails, which is not
desireable. Make the swift connection lazy load.

Change-Id: I8940e4784f8e91a3f2cc9d06f027d47f12ad3087
"}]
commit_message:
swift-plugin: lazy load of swift connection

Swift bank plugin's ctor is trying to create a swift connection. If
keystone or swift are down, loading of the provider fails, which is not
desireable. Make the swift connection lazy load.

Change-Id: I8940e4784f8e91a3f2cc9d06f027d47f12ad3087

revisions:
[{'number': 17, 'created': '2017-02-06 19:41:45.000000000', 'files': ['rally/plugins/openstack/verification/tempest/manager.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/verification/tempest/config.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/verification/tempest/context.py', 'rally/ui/templates/ci/index_verify.html', 'tests/unit/verification/test_utils.py', 'rally/verification/manager.py', 'doc/source/verification/howto/migrate_from_old_design.rst', 'tests/unit/cli/commands/test_verify.py', 'rally/plugins/common/verification/testr.py', 'rally/exceptions.py', 'rally/verification/utils.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/verification/tempest/test_context.py', 'rally/cli/commands/verify.py', 'rally/plugins/openstack/verification/tempest/config.ini', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/verification/tempest/test_config.py', 'tests/unit/plugins/openstack/verification/tempest/test_manager.py'], 'message': "[Verify] Refactoring of Tempest verifier plugin

The main goal of this patch is to move Tempest context related code
from the rally/plugins/openstack/verification/tempest/config.py file
to the separate rally/plugins/openstack/verification/tempest/context.py
file.

Also,

1. Functions such as 'add_extra_options' and 'extend_configfile' were
   moved from the rally/plugins/openstack/verification/tempest/config.py
   file to rally/verification/utils.py because these functions can be
   used by other verifier plugins in the future.

2. Now Tempest log, test image and lock files are stored in the
   corresponding deployment directory.

3. Now the 'floating_network_name' option from the 'network' section is
   configured as well.

4. A small cleanup was done.

Change-Id: I12c7918400c736b71c5a8044bb1aa53122fb96f1
"}]
commit_message:
[Verify] Refactoring of Tempest verifier plugin

The main goal of this patch is to move Tempest context related code
from the rally/plugins/openstack/verification/tempest/config.py file
to the separate rally/plugins/openstack/verification/tempest/context.py
file.

Also,

1. Functions such as 'add_extra_options' and 'extend_configfile' were
   moved from the rally/plugins/openstack/verification/tempest/config.py
   file to rally/verification/utils.py because these functions can be
   used by other verifier plugins in the future.

2. Now Tempest log, test image and lock files are stored in the
   corresponding deployment directory.

3. Now the 'floating_network_name' option from the 'network' section is
   configured as well.

4. A small cleanup was done.

Change-Id: I12c7918400c736b71c5a8044bb1aa53122fb96f1

commit_message:
Add jclouds implementation to Getting Started for firstapp

Add the java implementation of the "Getting Started" chapter of
the FirstApp tutorial.  Based on the Python version, it's
structured in the same way to keep the overall information
architecture the same, so it doesn't really LOOK like Java
(in that it's very procedural) but it shows how to do what
needs to be done.

Also fixed whitespace.

Change-Id: Iaa008f2ea4017db33d1222ee9c776f97616a59a8
Partial-bug: 1449330

subject: nova: confiugre cells db without bind_address
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-07 04:10:43.000000000', 'files': ['puppet/services/nova-api.yaml'], 'message': "nova: confiugre cells db without bind_address

Nova cell_v2 stores the mysql db connection string for
each cell database in a table in the api db.
In a HA deployment this connection string includes the
IP address for the client to bind to (different on each node).
The default behavior of the cell_v2 setup is to take the
connection string from nova.conf, but this will result in
DB connect failing on every node except the node where
cell_v2 setup was run.
However I assume it's not simply a case of stripping this
param from the connection string as we would have regression
of https://launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1643487.

This patch forces the nova-manager comment to not use bind_address and
use regular db connection url.

Change-Id: I765a118ef920811e32378602ce003659436cb3ba
Closes-Bug: #1662344
"}]
commit_message:
nova: confiugre cells db without bind_address

Nova cell_v2 stores the mysql db connection string for
each cell database in a table in the api db.
In a HA deployment this connection string includes the
IP address for the client to bind to (different on each node).
The default behavior of the cell_v2 setup is to take the
connection string from nova.conf, but this will result in
DB connect failing on every node except the node where
cell_v2 setup was run.
However I assume it's not simply a case of stripping this
param from the connection string as we would have regression
of https://launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1643487.

This patch forces the nova-manager comment to not use bind_address and
use regular db connection url.

Change-Id: I765a118ef920811e32378602ce003659436cb3ba
Closes-Bug: #1662344

neutron/url option to another class. So we need a workaround
for duplicate declaration.

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-03 16:42:07.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/horizon_install.yml'], 'message': 'Add retries for horizon venv download

Previous horizon attempt download venv from repo without retries.
This would simply fail when common HTTP 503 happens. This patch

commit_message:
Add retries for horizon venv download

Previous horizon attempt download venv from repo without retries.
This would simply fail when common HTTP 503 happens. This patch
will give more deplay and chance to let download go through.

Change-Id: I0c38d23c9981e1cc92a12bcf5bff34edd9828a0b
Closes-Bug: 1661374

subject: Do revert NAT to ICMP embedded packet
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-02-06 03:20:48.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/dnat_app.py', 'dragonflow/tests/fullstack/test_apps.py', 'dragonflow/tests/common/app_testing_objects.py'], 'message': 'Do revert NAT to ICMP embedded packet

According to RFC5508, the embedded packet of icmp message should
do revert NAT. Or else, the icmp packet will become invalid.

Change-Id: Iaf4f1793d35b513e9573726707042de3aad4fce3
Partially-implements: blueprint traceroute-support
'}]
commit_message:
Do revert NAT to ICMP embedded packet

According to RFC5508, the embedded packet of icmp message should
do revert NAT. Or else, the icmp packet will become invalid.

Change-Id: Iaf4f1793d35b513e9573726707042de3aad4fce3
Partially-implements: blueprint traceroute-support

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-02-03 06:48:28.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/common/icmp_error_generator.py', 'dragonflow/tests/fullstack/test_objects.py', 'dragonflow/controller/dnat_app.py', 'dragonflow/tests/fullstack/test_apps.py', 'dragonflow/tests/common/app_testing_objects.py'], 'message': 'Handle TTL invalid packets(dnat app)

As a NAT device, which logically bases on router, the dnat app in
dragonflow should decrease ttl when do NAT to the packet.

This patch will create/reply an ICMP Time exceed message if the ttl
is invalid after Decrement.

Change-Id: I346ecbc4b6bd9cb4b695b67c7eb1571218e80bef
Partially-implements: blueprint traceroute-support
'}]
commit_message:
Handle TTL invalid packets(dnat app)

As a NAT device, which logically bases on router, the dnat app in
dragonflow should decrease ttl when do NAT to the packet.

This patch will create/reply an ICMP Time exceed message if the ttl
is invalid after Decrement.

Change-Id: I346ecbc4b6bd9cb4b695b67c7eb1571218e80bef
Partially-implements: blueprint traceroute-support

subject: Prevent match overlap in L3_LOOKUP_TABLE
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-03 07:10:40.000000000', 'files': ['dragonflow/controller/dnat_app.py', 'dragonflow/controller/l3_proactive_app.py'], 'message': 'Prevent match overlap in L3_LOOKUP_TABLE

The openflows rule for routing between tenant networks and rule for
redirect fip share the same priority 100 in L3_LOOKUP_TABLE. This is
potential match overlap. Use different priorities for them.

Change-Id: I49751cbb4022293283ad6b1c6795bf2cafbb601a
Closes-bug: #1659217
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent match overlap in L3_LOOKUP_TABLE

The openflows rule for routing between tenant networks and rule for
redirect fip share the same priority 100 in L3_LOOKUP_TABLE. This is
potential match overlap. Use different priorities for them.

Change-Id: I49751cbb4022293283ad6b1c6795bf2cafbb601a
Closes-bug: #1659217

revisions:

commit_message:
Fix reporting of profiler traces with multiple toplevels

The Profiler panel was only showing the first of potentally
many toplevel events in a request. This patch reinstates
those events by displaying the root event rather than
its first child.

Change-Id: Ifeb0c3ee16168335e7b41c1063897ccdf5511800
Closes-Bug: 1660449
(cherry picked from commit d256d0025f03d83e784286af5fbd06a95fb43b39)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-13 17:17:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/test_nova_manage.py', 'nova/cmd/manage.py'], 'message': "Accept simple_cell_setup to partially complete its tasks

We made a strong assumption where you would need to have compute nodes in
order to run simple_cells_setup() and if you weren't, we hard failed with
an exit code of 1.
That have strong implications for deployers running scripts that check exit
codes and where they see exit code 1 as a blocking state.

Instead, we should consider that since simple_cells_setup() is idempotent, it
is acceptable to have it run correctly but do partial work and leave the
deployer run again the command in order to fully complete its work.

Change-Id: I148ae49e5339669a2dd7ce06f7f6dc1c5402f6ba
Closes-Bug: #1656276
"}]
commit_message:
Accept simple_cell_setup to partially complete its tasks

We made a strong assumption where you would need to have compute nodes in
order to run simple_cells_setup() and if you weren't, we hard failed with
an exit code of 1.
That have strong implications for deployers running scripts that check exit
codes and where they see exit code 1 as a blocking state.

Instead, we should consider that since simple_cells_setup() is idempotent, it
is acceptable to have it run correctly but do partial work and leave the
deployer run again the command in order to fully complete its work.

Change-Id: I148ae49e5339669a2dd7ce06f7f6dc1c5402f6ba
Closes-Bug: #1656276

commit_message:
Fix ignored timezone value from local_settings

When django_timezone not set in session or cookie,
default value is taken from the settings file but in there
has to be looked as TIME_ZONE

Change-Id: Idf93084f654ab65a2ed0dba7bc583147210cf175
Closes-bug: #1660648

commit_message:
Remove deprecated calls to novaclient.v2.contrib

As from OpenStack Ocata calls to novaclient.v2.contrib.instance_action
and novaclient.v2.contrib.list_extensions are deprecated
in favour of novaclient.v2.instance_action and
novaclient.v2.list_extensions respectively

Closes-bug: #1661767

Change-Id: I75d89a897093ef24fdb7f2c4a7c29c00fb3b2327

commit_message:
Check if user.token attribute exists

If the user is admin or don't have an ID the identity panel
will be loaded. In any other case  the project panel will be loaded.
This will also check if the panel is unregistred, and if the
session has expired it will lead to the login screen.

Closes-Bug: #1659818
Change-Id: I27300e928855ec10ca5d2a623d636e50d756b698

commit_message:
Fix reporting of profiler traces with multiple toplevels

The Profiler panel was only showing the first of potentally
many toplevel events in a request. This patch reinstates
those events by displaying the root event rather than
its first child.

Change-Id: Ifeb0c3ee16168335e7b41c1063897ccdf5511800
Closes-Bug: 1660449

commit_message:
Prevent a bond for unrequired re-assembles

* Assemble bond members under bond in UP state
* FIX lost bridge parameter
* FIX lost 'use_carrier' bond property
* waiting for bond UP after slaves added
* additional flush IP addresses from slave while bond assemble

Change-Id: I568d852e65dc5d5c246e11deb0740f4a608f5ecc
Closes-bug: #1658981
Related-bug: #1657750

commit_message:
[Urgent] Fix error in XJob RPC API

1. What is the problem
After the patch for subnet update was merged, the patch for xjob
enhancement didn't modify the xjob rpc api for subnet update to
adapt the change brought by the enhancement.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Modify the xjob rpc api for subnet update.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
N/A.

Change-Id: Idd504a1fa1c57183983a3392dda1282be4d2ad53

In the future configuration can be expanded to allow per-service

Besides, the 'insecure' option (defaults to False) can be overridden

Closes-Bug: #1642515

commit_message:
Configure and use SSL-related requests options

This patch adds standard SSL options to IPA config and makes use of them
when making HTTP requests.

For now, a single set of certificates is used when needed.
In the future configuration can be expanded to allow per-service
certificates.

Besides, the 'insecure' option (defaults to False) can be overridden
through kernel command line parameter 'ipa-insecure'.
This will allow running IPA in CI-like environments with self-signed SSL
certificates.

Change-Id: I259d9b3caa9ba1dc3d7382f375b8e086a5348d80
Closes-Bug: #1642515

subject: osclient: Pass endpoint_type in kw_args to client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-05 05:32:36.000000000', 'files': ['rally/osclients.py'], 'message': 'osclient: Pass endpoint_type in kw_args to client

Heatclient expects a value for endpoint_type from kw_args or it
uses None. Rally.osclient does not pass endpoint_type to the
heatclient. To rectify this, the endpoint_type variable is
explicitly placed in kw_args and kw_args passed to
the Heat client constructor.

Change-Id: I34d826f4be449a58dbe0c939efecf42d6ffa9d3e
'}]
commit_message:
osclient: Pass endpoint_type in kw_args to client

Heatclient expects a value for endpoint_type from kw_args or it
uses None. Rally.osclient does not pass endpoint_type to the
heatclient. To rectify this, the endpoint_type variable is
explicitly placed in kw_args and kw_args passed to
the Heat client constructor.

Change-Id: I34d826f4be449a58dbe0c939efecf42d6ffa9d3e

commit_message:
Improve test coverage for share migration

- Added tests to validate the migration functionality
for a replicated share.
- Added tests to validate the extend and shrink
functionality on migrated share.
- Added tests to cover the preserve snapshot
functionality on migrated share.
- Current waiter logic in migration_progress
method of dummy driver causes every migration
test to take over 4 minutes to complete.
Therefore, updated the method to cut the
overall time in half and avoid the possible timeout.

Partially-Implements: bp ocata-migration-improvements
Change-Id: Ia7c7eb7b48b464aa670073e8c0795369bd972678

subject: Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-04 09:29:22.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/common/environment_format.py', 'heatclient/osc/v1/software_config.py', 'heatclient/tests/functional/osc/v1/test_readonly.py', 'heatclient/v1/shell.py', 'heatclient/common/template_format.py', 'heatclient/tests/unit/osc/v1/test_stack.py'], 'message': 'Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive
a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the Internet.
The function yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python
objects like integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: If9edb9cafa6600397589ce159481ccfd329ea99f
'}]
commit_message:
Replaces yaml.load() with yaml.safe_load()

Yaml.load() return Python object may be dangerous if you receive
a YAML document from an untrusted source such as the Internet.
The function yaml.safe_load() limits this ability to simple Python
objects like integers or lists.

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: If9edb9cafa6600397589ce159481ccfd329ea99f

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-06 20:59:00.000000000', 'files': ['CONTRIBUTING.rst', 'tools/test-setup.sh'], 'message': 'Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Update CONTRIBUTING.rst for this.

Needed-By: Ia298e25f9b15a2dcfc4553ea058fc2c0f3705a8b
Change-Id: I825b72e3f645d02f7efdb3315a12825a8c937759
(cherry picked from commit 353ab3904749987841e72846098433fb957936fc)
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Update CONTRIBUTING.rst for this.

Needed-By: Ia298e25f9b15a2dcfc4553ea058fc2c0f3705a8b
Change-Id: I825b72e3f645d02f7efdb3315a12825a8c937759
(cherry picked from commit 353ab3904749987841e72846098433fb957936fc)

Since legacy netvirt will be deprecated there is no point to work on
it. But new netvirt should be focused. So skip several test cases for
old netvirt and v2driver combination for now to allow patch to be
merged.

Change-Id: Ife59a2181fcc573a03c98c976ec961491fba0146
'}]
commit_message:
devstack: skip several test cases with v2driver and old netvirt

It turned out that test cases with v2driver and old netvirt that is
voting is a bit unstable.
Since legacy netvirt will be deprecated there is no point to work on
it. But new netvirt should be focused. So skip several test cases for
old netvirt and v2driver combination for now to allow patch to be
merged.

Change-Id: Ife59a2181fcc573a03c98c976ec961491fba0146

commit_message:
Use oslo-config-generator

This commit replaces the old configuration file generator from the
openstack.common.config module by oslo-config-generator [1]. It also
deletes files under tools/config which are now unused. New files are
added for the generator:

  - climate/opts.py is for collecting climate options
  - etc/climate/climate-config-generator.conf contains generator configs
  - etc/climate/README-climate.conf.txt describes how to generate a
    sample configuration file

In addition, a testenv:genconfig section is added to tox.ini and
settings for the oslo.config.opts entry point are added in setup.cfg.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.config/generator.html

Change-Id: Ifd352dee176310fd667d1523a85afd3ddf9ab5da
Closes-Bug: #1658908

subject: Preinstall pyOpenSSL
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-07 04:47:50.000000000', 'files': ['elements/fedora/package-installs.yaml'], 'message': 'Preinstall pyOpenSSL

With the warnings added in Ibfe69dc84246662ed8caa0d4c3e2edf68314c87e
we can see that this element is relying on map-packages to translate
the debian package name python-pyopenssl -> pyOpenSSL.

This makes no sense because this is not a generic element; it should
just use the fedora/redhat names directly.

Change-Id: Id6ecb6f978b60d6a527692692a408d1d35828de2
'}]
commit_message:
Preinstall pyOpenSSL

With the warnings added in Ibfe69dc84246662ed8caa0d4c3e2edf68314c87e
we can see that this element is relying on map-packages to translate
the debian package name python-pyopenssl -> pyOpenSSL.

This makes no sense because this is not a generic element; it should
just use the fedora/redhat names directly.

Change-Id: Id6ecb6f978b60d6a527692692a408d1d35828de2

commit_message:
Fixing enabling order for OSProfiler plugins

If the order to enable devstack plugins is ommited then it raises a
failure during the stack execution. This patch specifies this
requirement.

Change-Id: Ia25c9bcb24a3c4125b6c312ef4fc1c58bd324840
Related-Bug: #1656373
(cherry picked from commit 42c5b8fef1f00528b7ff4c9ee5d600c98e4acc21)

commit_message:

subject: Fix node deletion logic
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-07 07:19:11.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/unit/engine/test_node.py', 'senlin/engine/node.py', 'senlin/objects/node.py'], 'message': 'Fix node deletion logic

This is an optimization of the node deletion logic. Previously there was
a TODO item about checking if there are actions still running on the
node. A careful reasoning revealed that it is impossible. The node
delete logic has to start with a NODE_DELETE action which is already
locking the node. No other action could grab the lock.

Change-Id: I8a28164861c2a639d7de09c6a6a2c0ad6af4e878
(cherry picked from commit 83a55972c65c5b0de4caeb9c1ff971c4951bb29e)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix node deletion logic

This is an optimization of the node deletion logic. Previously there was
a TODO item about checking if there are actions still running on the
node. A careful reasoning revealed that it is impossible. The node
delete logic has to start with a NODE_DELETE action which is already
locking the node. No other action could grab the lock.

Change-Id: I8a28164861c2a639d7de09c6a6a2c0ad6af4e878
(cherry picked from commit 83a55972c65c5b0de4caeb9c1ff971c4951bb29e)

subject: Replace six.iteritems() with .items()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-28 02:00:23.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_plugin/testing/tests/integration/test_models_methods.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable. 2.In py2, the performance about list
should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I7844f6425787388fa37b85b3c0f305b34cddc0fa
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using
six.iteritems to achieve iterators. We can use
dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable. 2.In py2, the performance about list
should be negligible, see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I7844f6425787388fa37b85b3c0f305b34cddc0fa

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-07 03:48:35.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': "Add _update_port method to the ML2 plug-in

The only difference between update_port and _update_port is that the
latter doesn't have the retry_if_session_inactive decorator. This is
needed because delete_subnet updates ports to remove ip addresses in the
subnet being deleted. When a retriable error occurs during the port
update, we need to retry the entire delete_subnet operation, to account
for situations where the port has ip addresses in several subnets and
several of them are being deleted in parallel. If only the port update
operation is retried, it may end up adding back to the port an ip
address belonging to one of the subnets that was deleted in parallel

Change-Id: I1346f12ac8e239eaee804e3d65927cf7a951741f
Partial-Bug: #1627424
"}]
commit_message:
Add _update_port method to the ML2 plug-in

The only difference between update_port and _update_port is that the
latter doesn't have the retry_if_session_inactive decorator. This is
needed because delete_subnet updates ports to remove ip addresses in the
subnet being deleted. When a retriable error occurs during the port
update, we need to retry the entire delete_subnet operation, to account
for situations where the port has ip addresses in several subnets and
several of them are being deleted in parallel. If only the port update
operation is retried, it may end up adding back to the port an ip
address belonging to one of the subnets that was deleted in parallel

Change-Id: I1346f12ac8e239eaee804e3d65927cf7a951741f
Partial-Bug: #1627424

subject: Filtering BGP VPN list with resource associations
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-03 13:51:49.000000000', 'files': ['networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/common/utils.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/opendaylight/odl.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/driver_api.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/db/bgpvpn_db.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/tests/unit/services/common/test_utils.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/bagpipe/bagpipe.py', 'releasenotes/notes/filtering-on-resource-association-2acdbc5b59d1a40a.yaml', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/plugin.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/neutron/services/service_drivers/opencontrail/opencontrail.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/tests/unit/db/test_db.py', 'networking_bgpvpn/tests/unit/services/common/__init__.py'], 'message': "Filtering BGP VPN list with resource associations

For db based drivers, use the Neutron db query hooks mechanism to apply
resource association filters on query results. That improvement permits to
remove two mandatory methods of the driver interface
'find_bgpvpns_for_network' and 'find_bgpvpns_for_router' which can be
replaced by the 'get_bgpvpns' method with appropriated filters.

For non db based drivers, improves utils method to filter resources with
a list of values instead of one value only. In that case, the resource
attribute value must contains filtered values at least (like it's done
for db based drivers).

Change-Id: Icbbb7ba704fbb3c025aabbddbb5121a2ecd852cc
Closes-Bug: #1659895
Implements blueprint api-find-bgpvpn-for-net
"}]
commit_message:
Filtering BGP VPN list with resource associations

For db based drivers, use the Neutron db query hooks mechanism to apply
resource association filters on query results. That improvement permits to
remove two mandatory methods of the driver interface
'find_bgpvpns_for_network' and 'find_bgpvpns_for_router' which can be
replaced by the 'get_bgpvpns' method with appropriated filters.

For non db based drivers, improves utils method to filter resources with
a list of values instead of one value only. In that case, the resource
attribute value must contains filtered values at least (like it's done
for db based drivers).

Change-Id: Icbbb7ba704fbb3c025aabbddbb5121a2ecd852cc
Closes-Bug: #1659895
Implements blueprint api-find-bgpvpn-for-net

subject: Turn down some low-value tracing output
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-02-07 04:26:56.000000000', 'files': ['bin/disk-image-create', 'elements/pkg-map/extra-data.d/10-create-pkg-map-dir', 'lib/common-functions'], 'message': 'Turn down some low-value tracing output

There are a couple of loops identified here that output a lot of
tracing each iteration for little value.  Make them only trace at
higher levels (-x -x and above).

Points of actual interest within the loops are replaced with an
explicit "echo" statement.

Additionally, export DIB_DEBUG_TRACE explicitly and in all cases, not
just when tracing is turned on.

Change-Id: Id710c0b111fc1f5e1ae87fc35f6db28b24867bad
'}]
commit_message:
Turn down some low-value tracing output

There are a couple of loops identified here that output a lot of
tracing each iteration for little value.  Make them only trace at
higher levels (-x -x and above).

Points of actual interest within the loops are replaced with an
explicit "echo" statement.

Additionally, export DIB_DEBUG_TRACE explicitly and in all cases, not
just when tracing is turned on.

Change-Id: Id710c0b111fc1f5e1ae87fc35f6db28b24867bad

From ocata onwards httpd+wsgi is the default mode of deployment
for heat api services with devstack. This also adds a non-apache
special job for running without mod_wsgi.

subject: Explain paginate_query doesn't provide parameter offset
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-06 15:24:56.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/sqlalchemy/utils.py'], 'message': 'Explain paginate_query doesn't provide parameter offset

OFFSET is a terrible thing to use.   It seems to work great when you
first use it because your table is only a few hundred rows.  six months
later, everyone complains the app is incredibly slow - it's because the
database is being killed doing linear scans through millions of rows
because everyone's doing OFFSET.  It not only causes slow and unusable
applications but hurts everyone by adding tons of meaningless work to
the DB load overall.

This pagination function already does the "right" way, which is to order
the rows and use WHERE criteria  (See http://use-the-index-luke.com/no-offset).

This commit add docstring to explain why don't need offset.

Co-Authored-By: Mike Bayer <mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com>
Change-Id: I6fdb094085d133c8910415efea2eb44225a66216
'}]
commit_message:
Explain paginate_query doesn't provide parameter offset

OFFSET is a terrible thing to use.   It seems to work great when you
first use it because your table is only a few hundred rows.  six months
later, everyone complains the app is incredibly slow - it's because the
database is being killed doing linear scans through millions of rows
because everyone's doing OFFSET.  It not only causes slow and unusable
applications but hurts everyone by adding tons of meaningless work to
the DB load overall.

This pagination function already does the "right" way, which is to order
the rows and use WHERE criteria  (See http://use-the-index-luke.com/no-offset).

This commit add docstring to explain why don't need offset.

Co-Authored-By: Mike Bayer <mike_mp@zzzcomputing.com>
Change-Id: I6fdb094085d133c8910415efea2eb44225a66216

subject: Adds keystone API version for auth_url in keystone api client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-19 16:35:14.000000000', 'files': ['climate/utils/openstack/keystone.py'], 'message': "Adds keystone API version for auth_url in keystone api client

Keystone client in blazar utility doesn't add keystone API version
in its auth_url. It causes 404 error when the client calls any
keystone API. For example, when the keystone client tries to create
trust, it fails and blazar raises error.

This patch adds API version in the auth url. Then blazar can call
Keystone API correctly.

Change-Id: Ib8edefe6e1fd1b81c75b955af0c1251e65d6c324
Closes-Bug: #1657827
"}]
commit_message:
Adds keystone API version for auth_url in keystone api client

Keystone client in blazar utility doesn't add keystone API version
in its auth_url. It causes 404 error when the client calls any
keystone API. For example, when the keystone client tries to create
trust, it fails and blazar raises error.

This patch adds API version in the auth url. Then blazar can call
Keystone API correctly.

Change-Id: Ib8edefe6e1fd1b81c75b955af0c1251e65d6c324
Closes-Bug: #1657827

commit_message:
Fix recovery action passing

This patch enables the CLUSTER_RECOVER to pass the input operation list
without stripping the first action. It also enables the nova server
profile type to determine whether the specified operation can be
invoked.

commit_message:
Use oslo.log library instead of system logging module

The constants of log levels were added in the 1.8 version of
the oslo.log library. So we can replace all usage of system
logging module with log module from oslo.log.
Use WritableLogger class from the loggers module of the oslo.log
library.

Change-Id: I8d04171cb8b46cf965ebfa56a648940e2ba7078b

commit_message:
Support nova non-live migration

Ensure that each compute node is configured with ssh key
authentication so that the nova compute service can use ssh
to move/resize disks to other nodes.

Change-Id: Ifbefdcbcf865cb2be988e133f19a13a5e010512d
Closes-Bug: #1660981

subject: Fix node deletion logic
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-03 04:07:45.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/tests/unit/engine/test_node.py', 'senlin/engine/node.py', 'senlin/objects/node.py'], 'message': 'Fix node deletion logic

This is an optimization of the node deletion logic. Previously there was
a TODO item about checking if there are actions still running on the
node. A careful reasoning revealed that it is impossible. The node
delete logic has to start with a NODE_DELETE action which is already
locking the node. No other action could grab the lock.

Change-Id: I8a28164861c2a639d7de09c6a6a2c0ad6af4e878
'}]
commit_message:
Fix node deletion logic

This is an optimization of the node deletion logic. Previously there was
a TODO item about checking if there are actions still running on the
node. A careful reasoning revealed that it is impossible. The node
delete logic has to start with a NODE_DELETE action which is already
locking the node. No other action could grab the lock.

Change-Id: I8a28164861c2a639d7de09c6a6a2c0ad6af4e878

commit_message:
Fixing enabling order for OSProfiler plugins

If the order to enable devstack plugins is ommited then it raises a
failure during the stack execution. This patch specifies this
requirement.

Change-Id: Ia25c9bcb24a3c4125b6c312ef4fc1c58bd324840
Related-Bug: #1656373

subject: Target map-packages deprecation message
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-02-07 04:45:27.000000000', 'files': ['elements/redhat-common/bin/map-packages', 'elements/rhel/bin/map-packages'], 'message': "Target map-packages deprecation message

Currently every run of install-packages puts out a warning that
map-packages is obsolete.  This happens even if map-package does no
mapping.  The caller can't prevent the call (it's part of
install-packages) and it gives no actionable help if there is
something wrong.

Keep track of any mappings we are doing in the obsolete map-packages
run and only output a warning if we actually translate anything.  If
we do output, tell the caller what packages were translated so they
can make appropriate pkg-map entries.

Change-Id: Ibfe69dc84246662ed8caa0d4c3e2edf68314c87e
"}]
commit_message:
Target map-packages deprecation message

Currently every run of install-packages puts out a warning that
map-packages is obsolete.  This happens even if map-package does no
mapping.  The caller can't prevent the call (it's part of
install-packages) and it gives no actionable help if there is
something wrong.

Keep track of any mappings we are doing in the obsolete map-packages
run and only output a warning if we actually translate anything.  If
we do output, tell the caller what packages were translated so they
can make appropriate pkg-map entries.

Change-Id: Ibfe69dc84246662ed8caa0d4c3e2edf68314c87e

subject: yum/install-packages output cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-07 04:50:01.000000000', 'files': ['elements/yum/bin/install-packages'], 'message': 'yum/install-packages output cleanup

Rather than echo the package list separately, turn on tracing around
the yum/dnf call so that we get more complete output.  No loss of
info, as this effecitvely shows the packgae list; plus it has the
bonus that it makes more sense in the logs, because otherwise you get
all the yum/dnf output without knowing what the call was.

Change-Id: I44df6e944af602e6b03f669c15a521056de1ad79
'}]
commit_message:
yum/install-packages output cleanup

Rather than echo the package list separately, turn on tracing around
the yum/dnf call so that we get more complete output.  No loss of
info, as this effecitvely shows the packgae list; plus it has the
bonus that it makes more sense in the logs, because otherwise you get
all the yum/dnf output without knowing what the call was.

Change-Id: I44df6e944af602e6b03f669c15a521056de1ad79

commit_message:
Remove a py34 environment from tox

Infra has been running python35 jobs, replaced the python34 jobs.
This is due to the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only
python3.5 is available.

So we should remove py34 environment with the same definitions.

Change-Id: I87625c1b9cfe96f05aaa2c12a6dd22ab7ef9d625

1. What is the problem
Some source files are still importing objects instead of modules

2. What is the solution to the problem
This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
N/A.

Change-Id: Ib84188a761ad7403ee72f5336b631235ea5dda90

commit_message:
Clean imports in code

1. What is the problem
Some source files are still importing objects instead of modules

2. What is the solution to the problem
This patch set modifies lines which are importing objects
instead of modules. As per openstack import guide lines, user should
import modules in a file not objects.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#imports

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
N/A.

Change-Id: Ib84188a761ad7403ee72f5336b631235ea5dda90

subject: Prepare for using standard python tests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-06 20:58:31.000000000', 'files': ['CONTRIBUTING.rst', 'tools/test-setup.sh'], 'message': 'Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Update CONTRIBUTING.rst for this.

Needed-By: Ia298e25f9b15a2dcfc4553ea058fc2c0f3705a8b
Change-Id: I825b72e3f645d02f7efdb3315a12825a8c937759
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Update CONTRIBUTING.rst for this.

Needed-By: Ia298e25f9b15a2dcfc4553ea058fc2c0f3705a8b
Change-Id: I825b72e3f645d02f7efdb3315a12825a8c937759

commit_message:
Using yaml.safe_load instead of yaml.load

It is not safe to call yaml.load with any data received from
an untrusted source, we'd better use yaml.safe_load

Reference:
https://security.openstack.org/guidelines/dg_avoid-dangerous-input-parsing-libraries.html

Change-Id: I9f1dbad19fde593271c1846ba2cc1bdb4d17ec80

subject: Use strings in package-installs follow output
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-18 08:26:56.000000000', 'files': ['elements/package-installs/bin/package-installs-v2'], 'message': "Use strings in package-installs follow output

I noticed in debugging that with python3 all the pkg-installs output
is preceeded by a b'foo', which suggests coding issues lurking.

The universal_newlines argument makes subprocess readline() returns a
decoded str (via locale) instead of a byte-string.  This clears up a
couple of points where we explicitly decode and cleans up the print
output.

Minor formatting cleanup of command and exit display.  Don't strip the
leading spaces so indents retain in the output

Change-Id: I2894f10a0c2fc618563641b9d106b716f4a544aa
"}]
commit_message:
Use strings in package-installs follow output

I noticed in debugging that with python3 all the pkg-installs output
is preceeded by a b'foo', which suggests coding issues lurking.

The universal_newlines argument makes subprocess readline() returns a
decoded str (via locale) instead of a byte-string.  This clears up a
couple of points where we explicitly decode and cleans up the print
output.

Minor formatting cleanup of command and exit display.  Don't strip the
leading spaces so indents retain in the output

Change-Id: I2894f10a0c2fc618563641b9d106b716f4a544aa

commit_message:
Simplify dependency validations

The dependency validations are all very similar and follow the same
pattern.
Hence, a refactor was done to simplify the dependency validations and
streamline the validation process.

This should provide more maintainable code and hopefully help spot any
potential issues while avoiding mistakes by future validations that will
be added.

Change-Id: If7a1ba59d6ed0bf9a028d514d1580e18c9602bfd

commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Update CONTRIBUTING.rst for this.

Needed-By: Ia298e25f9b15a2dcfc4553ea058fc2c0f3705a8b
Change-Id: I825b72e3f645d02f7efdb3315a12825a8c937759
(cherry picked from commit 353ab3904749987841e72846098433fb957936fc)

subject: Use stored value in OS::Heat::Value resource
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-03 20:15:22.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/value.py'], 'message': "Use stored value in OS::Heat::Value resource

Currently when getting the 'value' attribute of an OS::Heat::Value
resource, we recalculate the value from the properties - which means
re-resolving any functions, including get_attr and the like. That's
expensive and opens the possibility that the value can change over time,
which is probably not what users would expect.

Use the property values stored in the database at the time the resource was
created or last updated instead.

Change-Id: If0f80cab94c28514d1569b1025362ab9d9d31512
Closes-Bug: #1661728
"}]
commit_message:
Use stored value in OS::Heat::Value resource

Currently when getting the 'value' attribute of an OS::Heat::Value
resource, we recalculate the value from the properties - which means
re-resolving any functions, including get_attr and the like. That's
expensive and opens the possibility that the value can change over time,
which is probably not what users would expect.

Use the property values stored in the database at the time the resource was
created or last updated instead.

Change-Id: If0f80cab94c28514d1569b1025362ab9d9d31512
Closes-Bug: #1661728

subject: Proxy API endpoints that UI uses
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4978, 'name': 'Julie Pichon', 'email': 'jpichon@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpichon'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 21794, 'name': 'Dan Trainor', 'email': 'dtrainor@redhat.com', 'username': 'dtrainor'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2017-02-04 01:04:16.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/ui.pp', 'templates/ui/tripleo_ui_config.js.erb', 'spec/classes/tripleo_ui_spec.rb', 'releasenotes/notes/proxy-api-endpoints-359e5fb64d80d400.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/remove-old-urls-dea2b7fdcb50dd48.yaml'], 'message': "Proxy API endpoints that UI uses

Add support to enable the UI to use paths via mod_proxy to access API
endpoints instead of connecting to each endpoint directly on a port
other than where the UI is served from.  This is necessary to prevent
certificate acceptance errors from non-Chrome browsers which take
exception to connections made to other ports on the same hostname, using
one SSL certificate.

This change extends the UI's Apache configuration to create one
mod_proxy location for each of the API endpoints that UI calls upon.
These mod_proxy (using ProxyPass, ProxyPassReverse) endpoints are
configured using new heira variables provided in the dependent commit.

Additionally, this change modifies the default UI configuration file to
include endpoint URLs formatted to use the new endpoint paths that are
created.

Removed puppet variables which were previously used to generate the
contents of the tripleo_ui_config.js template, since they are no longer
used to generate this file, replaced with the new endpoint URLs
formatted to use the new endpoint paths that are created.

Change-Id: I55e375ad462fa98e181277ec0bd88658e620e8ad
Implements: blueprint proxy-undercloud-api-services
Depends-On: Ib20f4b0891563ae90ec80675635a64c39bd2fdb7
"}]
commit_message:
Proxy API endpoints that UI uses

Add support to enable the UI to use paths via mod_proxy to access API
endpoints instead of connecting to each endpoint directly on a port
other than where the UI is served from.  This is necessary to prevent
certificate acceptance errors from non-Chrome browsers which take
exception to connections made to other ports on the same hostname, using
one SSL certificate.

This change extends the UI's Apache configuration to create one
mod_proxy location for each of the API endpoints that UI calls upon.
These mod_proxy (using ProxyPass, ProxyPassReverse) endpoints are
configured using new heira variables provided in the dependent commit.

Additionally, this change modifies the default UI configuration file to
include endpoint URLs formatted to use the new endpoint paths that are
created.

Removed puppet variables which were previously used to generate the
contents of the tripleo_ui_config.js template, since they are no longer
used to generate this file, replaced with the new endpoint URLs
formatted to use the new endpoint paths that are created.

Change-Id: I55e375ad462fa98e181277ec0bd88658e620e8ad
Implements: blueprint proxy-undercloud-api-services
Depends-On: Ib20f4b0891563ae90ec80675635a64c39bd2fdb7

commit_message:
Kill the metadata proxy process unconditionally

When force_metadata=True and enable_isolated_metadata=False,
the namespace metadata proxy process might not be terminated
when the network is deleted because the subnets and ports
will have already been deleted, so we could incorrectly
determine it was started. Calling destroy_monitored_metadata_proxy() is
a noop when there is no process running.

Change-Id: I77ff545ce02f2dca4c38e587b37ea809ad6f072c
Closes-Bug: #1648095
(cherry picked from commit a502c96b8efa62627e245ffa69a23f4b6d3f90a5)

commit_message:
Fix volatile CPU 'size'

The 'size' parameter for CPU returned by lshw is current CPU clock
which changes constantly breaking nailgun optimization which expects
hw data to not change each time.
This also must reduce probability of deadlocks in #1624230.

Change-Id: I7d9b5282991b17424d458c2612dfa4eeeb52be48
Partial-Bug: #1624230

commit_message:
pbr.version.VersionInfo needs package name (oslo.xyz and not oslo_xyz)

 We need to pass into VersionInfo what one would expect from running:
 setup.py --name

 Right now we pass in say oslo_context and pbr fails if there is no .git in
  the python source tree

  Closes-Bug: #1662266

Change-Id: I14e802131eab4fd4c1bdb2bde91c249e18f8236a

commit_message:
Fix updating images

Images weren't updated because yum didn't refresh its cache with
new repositories and continued to use the old cache, so almost
nothing was updated. Add "clean all" to refresh the repos before
update.

Related-Bug: #1661656
Change-Id: I1417b6901bb134e527371a133a89f60f7d76df66

commit_message:
Remove backslash from awk command in stackrc

This change removes the backslash from the awk command in stackrc
file as it's currently broken:

source stackrc
awk: cmd. line:1: {FS=\"=\"}  /^OS_/ {print $1}
awk: cmd. line:1:     ^ backslash not last character on line
awk: cmd. line:1: {FS=\"=\"}  /^OS_/ {print $1}
awk: cmd. line:1:     ^ syntax error

Change-Id: Ib1856d60a97c3f7cf488d056be0e05fa9a3a7248
Closes-Bug: 1662203

commit_message:
Prepare for using standard python tests

Add simple script to setup mysql and postgresql databases, this script
can be run by users during testing and will be run by CI systems for
specific setup before running unit tests. This is exactly what is
currently done by OpenStack CI in project-config.

This allows to change in project-config the python-db jobs to
python-jobs since python-jobs will call this script initially.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-November/107784.html

Update CONTRIBUTING.rst for this.

Needed-By: Ia298e25f9b15a2dcfc4553ea058fc2c0f3705a8b
Change-Id: I825b72e3f645d02f7efdb3315a12825a8c937759
(cherry picked from commit 353ab3904749987841e72846098433fb957936fc)

In the recent release of keystoneauth1 2.18.0 provision is made to log
x-openstack-request-id for session client. Once this new library is synced
in openstack projects, the x-openstack-request-id will be logged twice
on the console if session client is used.

For example,
$ neutron --debug port-list

DEBUG: keystoneauth.session GET call to network for
http://10.232.48.204:9696/v2.0/ports.json used request id
req-da75468a-2855-4e59-b308-d2a91776b927

DEBUG: neutronclient.v2_0.client GET call to neutron for

Above log will be logged twice on the console.

Removed logging of x-openstack-request-id in case of SessionClient as it
is already logged in keystoneauth1. x-openstack-request-id will only be
logged once on console if HTTPClient is used.

Depends-On: I63fb5e5486670bc369abc5339a2da8e65ba2ec6f
Closes-Bug: #1657351

Change-Id: I8efefd69a1ba4a214b1a30b20b9c1e5bd96b19d4
'}]
commit_message:
x-openstack-request-id logged twice in logs

In the recent release of keystoneauth1 2.18.0 provision is made to log
x-openstack-request-id for session client. Once this new library is synced
in openstack projects, the x-openstack-request-id will be logged twice
on the console if session client is used.

For example,
$ neutron --debug port-list

DEBUG: keystoneauth.session GET call to network for
http://10.232.48.204:9696/v2.0/ports.json used request id
req-da75468a-2855-4e59-b308-d2a91776b927

DEBUG: neutronclient.v2_0.client GET call to neutron for
http://10.232.48.204:9696/v2.0/ports.json used request id
req-da75468a-2855-4e59-b308-d2a91776b927

Above log will be logged twice on the console.

Removed logging of x-openstack-request-id in case of SessionClient as it
is already logged in keystoneauth1. x-openstack-request-id will only be
logged once on console if HTTPClient is used.

Depends-On: I63fb5e5486670bc369abc5339a2da8e65ba2ec6f
Closes-Bug: #1657351

Change-Id: I8efefd69a1ba4a214b1a30b20b9c1e5bd96b19d4

When start ovs-agent, method tunnel_sync will call

For each tunnel _setup_tunnel_port will be called once,

call is enough.

Change-Id: I80f25edb35a89c5476f5216e151a27cbd3dcd120

commit_message:
Improve tunnel_sync

When start ovs-agent, method tunnel_sync will call
_setup_tunnel_port when l2_pop is not enabled.
For each tunnel _setup_tunnel_port will be called once,
every call will add flood flows to br-tun. But one time
call is enough.

Change-Id: I80f25edb35a89c5476f5216e151a27cbd3dcd120
Co-Authored-By: Yan Xing an <yanxingan@cmss.chinamobile.com>
Closes-bug: #1589400

It was suggested by Nova team to not deploying Nova API in WSGI with
Apache in production.
It's causing some issues that we didn't catch until now (see in the bug
report).

Change-Id: I163c85337437704ec3668fc9fa5e2c40eb23248c

(cherry picked from commit beeb6a89257a68305d16104fff4fc3c7a5d06544)

commit_message:
Warn our users about Nova API in WSGI with Apache

It was suggested by Nova team to not deploying Nova API in WSGI with
Apache in production.
It's causing some issues that we didn't catch until now (see in the bug
report).

Change-Id: I163c85337437704ec3668fc9fa5e2c40eb23248c
Related-Bug: 1661360
(cherry picked from commit beeb6a89257a68305d16104fff4fc3c7a5d06544)

commit_message:
Cut back on the number of workers ran for neutron

The dedicated RPC worker is overkill in single or multinode
devstack deployments. Also metadata API workers was left
default, which meant they were as many as the CPU cores.

Related-bug: 1656386

Change-Id: Ibbf7787dfa48e13a51f961f3e0ee2b8f49964759

subject: fields: fix stringifying of objects when subclasses=True
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john.garbutt@stackhpc.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-02 14:16:37.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_fields.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/fields.py'], 'message': "fields: fix stringifying of objects when subclasses=True

When the 'Object' field stringifys a value, it is
currently hardcoded to report the object name that
the field was initialized with. This used to be
sufficient, until the 'subclasses' parameter was
added. When subclasses=True, the value may be any
arbitrary subclass, so we should be reporting the
actual object name associated with the value.

Closes-Bug: #1638577
Change-Id: I0bb4ade30a60554710a12f0f058945ef43826eff
"}]
commit_message:
fields: fix stringifying of objects when subclasses=True

When the 'Object' field stringifys a value, it is
currently hardcoded to report the object name that
the field was initialized with. This used to be
sufficient, until the 'subclasses' parameter was
added. When subclasses=True, the value may be any
arbitrary subclass, so we should be reporting the
actual object name associated with the value.

Closes-Bug: #1638577
Change-Id: I0bb4ade30a60554710a12f0f058945ef43826eff

Dummy does not have value aging mechanisms and value
filtering mechanisms. Like redis, we should use these
two mechanisms

Closes-Bug: #1658940

commit_message:
pbr.version.VersionInfo needs package name (oslo.xyz and not oslo_xyz)

 We need to pass into VersionInfo what one would expect from running:
 setup.py --name

 Right now we pass in say oslo_context and pbr fails if there is no .git in
  the python source tree

  Closes-Bug: #1662266

Change-Id: I6bb3594ad625e0538cc8c654d679886b8302719a

subject: Revert "Enable debug logging in unit tests"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-06 16:02:27.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/common.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Enable debug logging in unit tests"

This reverts commit 94565e709756b4bcc0a453ec71ef49bf887e1aae.

Apparently the extra overhead of converting the testr storage format to subunit doubles the size of the file, placing in on the borderline of the gate's 50MB limit, which is inexplicably applied to the uncompressed data (this change added only ~200kB to the size of the gzipped subunit file afaict).

Change-Id: Ic458be0fa273c1ba94dacb9a5233220ccc7c606d
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Enable debug logging in unit tests"

This reverts commit 94565e709756b4bcc0a453ec71ef49bf887e1aae.

Apparently the extra overhead of converting the testr storage format to subunit doubles the size of the file, placing in on the borderline of the gate's 50MB limit, which is inexplicably applied to the uncompressed data (this change added only ~200kB to the size of the gzipped subunit file afaict).

Change-Id: Ic458be0fa273c1ba94dacb9a5233220ccc7c606d

commit_message:
pbr.version.VersionInfo needs package name (oslo.xyz and not oslo_xyz)

 We need to pass into VersionInfo what one would expect from running:
 setup.py --name

 Right now we pass in say oslo_context and pbr fails if there is no .git in
  the python source tree

  Closes-Bug: #1662266

Change-Id: I6a4c2875d45609c5bc7326273a2e9b45fde6c085

pbr.version.VersionInfo needs package name (oslo.xyz and not oslo_xyz)

 We need to pass into VersionInfo what one would expect from running:
 setup.py --name

 Right now we pass in say oslo_context and pbr fails if there is no .git in
  the python source tree

  Closes-Bug: #1662266

Change-Id: Ief1b4cf71bb0830160ff91b0d359042618038931

subject: WIP: RFC: Set item expiration in memcached
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-04 03:14:05.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_cache/core.py'], 'message': 'WIP: RFC: Set item expiration in memcached

Set the item expiration in memcached in addition to setting the dogpile
expiration. Without this setting dogpile will handle not returning
expired data, but it will remain in memcached until it forcibly exicted
to reclaim memory. With this setting the data will expire in memcached
and will be removed either when the item is accessed after expiration
or when forcibly evicted to reclaimed memory.

Change-Id: I8c9d730846cc7f04ea8ca8e7b4f7d08704a462d1
Closes-Bug: #1578401
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: RFC: Set item expiration in memcached

Set the item expiration in memcached in addition to setting the dogpile
expiration. Without this setting dogpile will handle not returning
expired data, but it will remain in memcached until it forcibly exicted
to reclaim memory. With this setting the data will expire in memcached
and will be removed either when the item is accessed after expiration
or when forcibly evicted to reclaimed memory.

Change-Id: I8c9d730846cc7f04ea8ca8e7b4f7d08704a462d1
Closes-Bug: #1578401

commit_message:
Add profile_file option for profiling

This is related to https://review.openstack.org/267905.
Interpretation of profile outputs aren't straightforward; they
contain erroneous values caused by greenlet switches.

Change-Id: Iee7a3ba269b14995796501e6f20fbf52c115ad8d

revisions:

It was suggested by Nova team to not deploying Nova API in WSGI with
Apache in production.
It's causing some issues that we didn't catch until now (see in the bug
report).

Change-Id: I163c85337437704ec3668fc9fa5e2c40eb23248c
Related-Bug: 1661360
(cherry picked from commit beeb6a89257a68305d16104fff4fc3c7a5d06544)
"}]
commit_message:
Warn our users about Nova API in WSGI with Apache

It was suggested by Nova team to not deploying Nova API in WSGI with
Apache in production.
It's causing some issues that we didn't catch until now (see in the bug
report).

Change-Id: I163c85337437704ec3668fc9fa5e2c40eb23248c
Related-Bug: 1661360
(cherry picked from commit beeb6a89257a68305d16104fff4fc3c7a5d06544)
